summary: This document is an email chain from October 28, 2019, discussing scheduling confusion for a meeting involving Mark Epstein. The emails are between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and another individual, possibly a defense attorney, trying to confirm whether a meeting is set for October 28 or October 31, 2019.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mark Epstein is the subject of a meeting being scheduled; he is flying in from Florida based on the original conversation.

events.title: Scheduled meeting confusion
events.description: Email chain reveals confusion over whether a meeting involving Mark Epstein was scheduled for October 28 or October 31, 2019.

events.title: Proposed meeting date
events.description: A meeting involving Mark Epstein is proposed for October 31, 2019, at 3:00 p.m.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein was flying from Florida to attend a meeting in late October 2019.
There was significant scheduling confusion between parties, with dates of October 28 and October 31, 2019, being discussed.
An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York was involved in scheduling this meeting.
The email chain suggests legal or investigative proceedings involving Mark Epstein were ongoing in October 2019.
